intro: Frangula atagualpae, commonly known as the Mexican buckthorn, is a shrub native to the highlands of Mexico. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes other plants like citrus and buckthorn. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule containing several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Frangula atagualpae is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
